meanings.definition: A person who is excessively concerned with minor details and rules.
meanings.sent1: Some pedants insist on following every rule to the letter.
meanings.sent2: The pedants in the group always point out small mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The pedants at the meeting argued about the tiniest details for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her father was a pedant when it came to grammar, correcting every sentence she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The pedants in the class made sure everyone followed the instructions exactly.

meanings.sent1: The bookshelves were filled with books written by famous pedants.
meanings.sent2: The pedants gathered for a conference to discuss language and literature.
meanings.sent3: The pedants in the library formed a book club to debate classic works.
meanings.sent4: In the world of academia, pedants are often revered for their knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The pedants' collection of rare manuscripts was the envy of many scholars.
